sen.j: 悪逆（あくぎゃく）とは、律令法に定められた八虐の一つ。
sen.e: Akugyaku was one of hachi-gyaku (eight unpardonable crimes) defined by the ritsuryo (legal codes of the Nara and Heian periods).

sen.j: 両親・祖父母に対する傷害・殺人、伯叔父母・外祖父母（母方の祖父母）・兄・姉に対する殺人を指す。
sen.e: It refers to injuring or killing the parent(s)/ grandparent(s) or killing uncle(s)/ aunt(s), (maternal parent(s))/elder brother(s)/elder sister(s).
It refers to the wounding or killing of the parent(s)/ grandparent(s) or the killing of uncle(s)/ aunt(s), maternal grandparent(s)/elder brother(s)/elder sister(s).

sen.j: 更に女性の場合には夫とその両親に対する殺人が含まれる。
sen.e: In female cases it also included killing their husbands and parents.
In female cases it also included killing their husband and his parent(s).

sen.j: 八虐においては第4位、家庭内の問題に纏わる問題では最も重い罪とされている。
sen.e: Among hachi-gyaku it ranked fourth and was regarded as the most serious crime involving a family.
Among hachi-gyaku it ranked fourth and was regarded as the most serious crime among the ones involving a family.

sen.j: 罪自体の軽重とは別に一切の社会的特権を剥奪され、恩赦の対象からも外された。
sen.e: Apart from the gravity of a crime, all social privileges were deprived and also no amnesty was granted.

sen.j: 今日、人道に反した残虐な振る舞いを「悪逆無道」と呼称するのはこれに由来する。
sen.e: Nowadays naming cruel behaviors "akugyaku-mudo (atrocities)" derives from this.
The term "akugyaku-mudo," which is used today to describe cruel behaviors against humanity, is derived from it.
